text: well in prison you try to do one hour
first and then you try to do 24 hours
and then seven days and a month and a
year but I think if you're caught in a
net the more you struggle the more
entangled you are going to get well I
want to go back tomorrow
and as soon as the situation improves I
would like the president to come out and
free all the political prisoners can I
ask you about sanctions because your
lawyers have one support for a u.s.
congressional resolution calling for
sanctions
do you support targeted protection well
we want people who are abusing human
rights in the Maldives to be banned from
traveling to other countries their
assets and their funds to be held until
they relent most of these people have
quite substantial amount of funds abroad
I think it's very difficult to predict
what may or may not happen in the future
but just to clarify also the UN working
groups opinion we are very well aware of
it and that's pretty damning isn't it it
says it's an unfair trial and therefore
the man shouldn't be in prison so my
question is not about my question is not
about the rights and wrongs of that but
whether you would expect a man who
thinks he's in prison with no
justification at all to actually come
back into prison but are you expecting
him to come back you said you don't have
opinion on his appeal at the moment and
it is in his interest to return to see
that his rights are respected
